lead_paragraph: In 1997, when I was about to go on a short book leave, I finally had to break down and buy my first laptop. I was leaning toward a Mac. The person I was dating at the time, who knew a lot more about computers than I did, advised me to get something else. "Apple won't be around in a year," he said. I bought a Mac anyway. The relationship ended a few years later, not long before I bought my first iPod. . . .

headline.main: Steve Jobs and the Roads, Taken and Not
